channel.title: Some Questions// Very important. Please help :confused:
channel.description:
I have a couple of questions that I like to be answered. I just started in setting up a mopar server so I have totally no experience in doing these stuff. ;D
My first question: I have downloaded a source in this forum but this source didnt include a client to start up the server. So how do I make a client for this source or do I have to download a pre-maden client for this.
My second question: How to I host my server on the internet. I dont want to host it on moparscape that people have to play through this site. I will made my own site for this but where do I have to host this server. I have heard of no-ip. So I made a host in no-ip.com but I only got a IP :confused: . So what now :|. What do I have to do with this IP, dont I have to host my server on this IP but there is no function. In a tutorial it said to download No-IP DUC. Downloaded this but still what do I have to with this program.
Please help me with those questions and I will thank you very very much :D
Regards

item.title: Some Questions// Very important. Please help :confused:
item.dc:creator: @blackbird070 blackbird070
item.description:
@blackbird070 wrote:

[quote=“Epic Steve, post:21, topic:357975”]To compile, use this.

@echo off
javac *.java
pause

Or you can use an IDE.[/quote]

And do I have to change something in run.bat?

Read full topic
item.source: Some Questions// Very important. Please help :confused:

item.title: Some Questions// Very important. Please help :confused:
item.dc:creator: @Epic_Steve Epic Steve
item.description:
@Epic_Steve wrote:

To compile, use this.

@echo off
javac *.java
pause

Or you can use an IDE.

Read full topic
item.source: Some Questions// Very important. Please help :confused:

item.title: Some Questions// Very important. Please help :confused:
item.dc:creator: @blackbird070 blackbird070
item.description:
@blackbird070 wrote:

[quote=“Epic Steve, post:19, topic:357975”]The JDK is the Java Development Kit, this includes the tools to compile your source code (.java) into bytecode (.class).
The bytecode is the read by the JVM this is what makes Java a universal language (can run on all operating systems).

The only thing needed to be running is your server.

Also, to edit your server you will need to know basic Java. There’s a bunch of tutorials on the internet and the Java website.[/quote]

But dont I have to change something in Compile with notepad or something for that java. I have seen this in many tutorials.

And do you know a client for my source that I can use.

Read full topic
item.source: Some Questions// Very important. Please help :confused:

item.title: Some Questions// Very important. Please help :confused:
item.dc:creator: @Epic_Steve Epic Steve
item.description:
@Epic_Steve wrote:

The JDK is the Java Development Kit, this includes the tools to compile your source code (.java) into bytecode (.class).
The bytecode is the read by the JVM this is what makes Java a universal language (can run on all operating systems).

The only thing needed to be running is your server.

Also, to edit your server you will need to know basic Java. There’s a bunch of tutorials on the internet and the Java website.

Read full topic
item.source: Some Questions// Very important. Please help :confused:

item.title: Some Questions// Very important. Please help :confused:
item.dc:creator: @blackbird070 blackbird070
item.description:
@blackbird070 wrote:

Thanks you so MUCH :eek:

LOl this post almost look like a complete tutorial

I will maybe make some other post for any other questions
But U know a client that I can use for this source cuz i like my source right now very much

Can u please please make a list for me that have to be 24/7 up running so that people can play and I can play
And whats the point of JDK dont I have to change some info in my source so its connected to JDK ass well

U answered a lot of questions but this is then the last question.
Can u give me a topic that explains how to edit Java things of my server.

Read full topic
item.source: Some Questions// Very important. Please help :confused:

item.title: Some Questions// Very important. Please help :confused:
item.dc:creator: @Epic_Steve Epic Steve
item.description:
@Epic_Steve wrote:

[quote=“blackbird070, post:16, topic:357975”][quote author=Epic Steve link=topic=454490.msg3328089#msg3328089 date=1283261697]
Most people leave there computers on 24/7 anyway, like me.

[i]A virtual private server provides the features of a dedicated server on a machine that is shared by other Web hosting customers
[/quote]

NICE NICE .

Alot clearer thanks so much.

But maybe I will buy a VPS. Do ya know a tutorial how I host the server on a VPS?

PS: What is the name of ur rsps gonna take a look.
BTW: ISNT ur comp exploding right now?[/quote]
First, http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,429240.0.html

Second, I don’t have one ^.^ I just come on to help people, haha.
Third, nope, my computer is fine no noise at all.

Read full topic

item.source: Some Questions// Very important. Please help :confused:

item.title: Some Questions// Very important. Please help :confused:
item.dc:creator: @blackbird070 blackbird070
item.description:
@blackbird070 wrote:

[quote=“Epic Steve, post:13, topic:357975”][quote author=blackbird070 link=topic=454490.msg3328069#msg3328069 date=1283261171]
Thanks very much

But what do you mean with portforward.
But is it neccessary that my comp is 24/7 to run my server so that run.bat is always open. So People can only play when I am online?
[/quote]
Unless you buy a VPS then yes, your server can only be hosted if your computer is online.

PS; you can try this for port forwarding.

http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,442058.0.html[/quote]

OMG! but there are so many servers that are 24/7 up like corruptionx. They all have bought a fking VPS?

BTW what is a vps

Read full topic

PS; you can try this for port forwarding.

item.source: Some Questions// Very important. Please help :confused:

item.title: Some Questions// Very important. Please help :confused:
item.dc:creator: @Siccc Siccc
item.description:
@Siccc wrote:

What you are going to want to do is, setup a no-ip account, create a host, put your ip you made in your client, as we told you before. Compile. Download no-ip duc. Port forward 43594. Open the No-Ip DUC. Run your server using the run.bat. Open your client and login. There are plenty of tutorials around here, use the search button. You’ll most likely get done faster then waiting for people to reply to you.

Read full topic
item.source: Some Questions// Very important. Please help :confused:

item.title: Some Questions// Very important. Please help :confused:
item.dc:creator: @Epic_Steve Epic Steve
item.description:
@Epic_Steve wrote:

The no-Ip is a redirect to your IP. It’s so you don’t have to give out your IP. Bascially all you do is signup for a No-Ip, then you portforward the port you’re hosting your server on, (43594 probably) then give people the no-ip, then they type it in the client and it connect. Simple.

Read full topic
item.source: Some Questions// Very important. Please help :confused:

item.title: Some Questions// Very important. Please help :confused:
item.dc:creator: @blackbird070 blackbird070
item.description:
@blackbird070 wrote:

[quote=“Epic Steve, post:8, topic:357975”]Step 1: Create No-Ip
Step 2: Portforward
Step 3: Upload client or use standard moparscape client
Step 4: ???
Step 5: PROFIT![/quote]
Dude the point I dont understand how to connect it to no-ip so its public do I have to host this on there? If yes how?
And portforward for what is this needed and maybe this is the answer to my first sentence. Maybe portforward is needed ;D

And maybe its to hardly to explain this to me so is there a vid tutorial?

Read full topic

item.title: Some Questions// Very important. Please help :confused:
item.dc:creator: @blackbird070 blackbird070
item.description:
@blackbird070 wrote:

[quote=“Dastan_, post:6, topic:357975”]ye , siccc is right. i forgot to mention that.

Good Good

But dont I have to upload the source so it can connect to no-ip?
So how can no-ip connect to your source?

And how do i connect my source to my client? ;D

Dont upload your server anywhere , dont do no ip’s cuz you are too nooby , it will just confuse you as im guessing.

After you change your ip and compile , go to your source files , run the run.bat file and then open your client.[/quote]

Dude I have experience in JAVA but only not this. And setted up my own habbo holocms. But this is something different cuz i want it to be public not a server for only me.

Read full topic
item.source: Some Questions// Very important. Please help :confused:

item.title: Some Questions// Very important. Please help :confused:
item.dc:creator: @Dastan1 Dastan_
item.description:
@Dastan1 wrote:

ye , siccc is right. i forgot to mention that.

Good Good

But dont I have to upload the source so it can connect to no-ip?
So how can no-ip connect to your source?

And how do i connect my source to my client? ;D

Dont upload your server anywhere , dont do no ip’s cuz you are too nooby , it will just confuse you as im guessing.

After you change your ip and compile , go to your source files , run the run.bat file and then open your client.

Read full topic
item.source: Some Questions// Very important. Please help :confused:

item.title: Some Questions// Very important. Please help :confused:
item.dc:creator: @blackbird070 blackbird070
item.description:
@blackbird070 wrote:

[quote=“Dastan_, post:2, topic:357975”]try downloading this one:

moparisthebest.com

moparisthebest.com

programming, irc, cars

to your second question…
when you downlaod this server.
go to your client files , look for GUI or EGUI.java - search for 127.0.0.1 or 0.0.0.0 or localhost and change it to your ip adress.
after you do this , find client.java , also in your client files ( not source ) and do the same thing.[/quote]

And please dude.
I have my own source and want that because its 562 so playing in HD.
And its a source of a existing private server that I really want and edit.

Read full topic
item.source: Some Questions// Very important. Please help :confused:

item.title: Some Questions// Very important. Please help :confused:
item.dc:creator: @Siccc Siccc
item.description:
@Siccc wrote:

[quote=“Dastan_, post:2, topic:357975”]try downloading this one:

moparisthebest.com

moparisthebest.com

programming, irc, cars

to your second question…
when you downlaod this server.
go to your client files , look for GUI or EGUI.java - search for 127.0.0.1 or 0.0.0.0 or localhost and change it to your ip adress.
after you do this , find client.java , also in your client files ( not source ) and do the same thing.[/quote]

A second note on that, don’t forget to compile. None of your changes will take place until you compile.

Read full topic

item.title: Some Questions// Very important. Please help :confused:
item.dc:creator: @Dastan1 Dastan_
item.description:
@Dastan1 wrote:

try downloading this one:

moparisthebest.com

moparisthebest.com

programming, irc, cars

to your second question…
when you downlaod this server.
go to your client files , look for GUI or EGUI.java - search for 127.0.0.1 or 0.0.0.0 or localhost and change it to your ip adress.
after you do this , find client.java , also in your client files ( not source ) and do the same thing.

Read full topic
